title: How to Turn Off an Xbox Controller on a Windows PC

steps.title: Slide off the back battery cover.
steps.content: Slide off the back battery cover. The easiest and most obvious way to turn off any controller is to remove its batteries. Although Microsoft suggests that you can turn off your Xbox controller by holding the Guide button down for six seconds, many users report issues with this method. Go for the sure thing by removing the batteries. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Remove one or both batteries.
steps.content: Remove one or both batteries. Simply jostling one of the batteries out of place will turn the controller off. You can then slide it back into place and put the battery cover back on. Your controller will remain off until you power it back on again.

steps.title: Hold down the Guide button for six seconds.
steps.content: Hold down the Guide button for six seconds. The official way to turn off a wireless Xbox controller is to hold down the Guide button for six seconds. [2] X Research source It is the large Xbox logo in the center of the controller. Some users report that this method does not work when gaming on a PC, which is why removing the battery pack may be your best bet. Hold down the Guide button for twelve seconds to completely reset the controller. This is a good idea if your controller is malfunctioning, as it will reboot with any available updated firmware.

steps.title: Disable Bluetooth on your PC.
steps.content: Disable Bluetooth on your PC. If you are using a wireless Xbox controller via Bluetooth, you can turn it off by disconnecting it from your PC. Navigate to your computer's Bluetooth settings and disable Bluetooth to sever the connection between your PC and your controller. The controller should then turn off as well.

steps.title: Disconnect a wired controller from your PC.
steps.content: Disconnect a wired controller from your PC. If you are using an Xbox controller via cable, unplug the cable at either end to turn off the controller. Then, you may plug it back in to turn it back on.
